intro: Varronia mollis, commonly known as the velvetleaf or tropical velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in wetlands and disturbed soils, thriving in humid, warm climates. Varronia mollis is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
